content5.ptxt: The fuel trim is related to the feedback compensation value, not to the basic injection duration. The fuel trim consists of both the short-term and long-term fuel trims.

The short-term fuel trim is fuel compensation that is used to constantly maintain the air fuel ratio at stoichiometric levels. The signal from the air fuel ratio sensor indicates whether the air fuel ratio is rich or lean compared to the stoichiometric ratio. This triggers a reduction in the fuel injection volume if the air fuel ratio is rich and an increase in the fuel injection volume if lean.

Factors such as individual engine differences, wear over time and changes in operating environment cause short-term fuel trim to vary from the central value. The long-term fuel trim, which controls overall fuel compensation, compensates for long-term deviations in the fuel trim from the central value caused by the short-term fuel trim compensation.

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: With a warm engine and stable air fuel ratio feedback, the fuel trim is considerably in error to the lean side (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: Open or short in air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1) circuit

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: With a warm engine and stable air fuel ratio feedback, the fuel trim is considerably in error to the rich side (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: Open or short in air fuel ratio sensor (bank 1 sensor 1) circuit

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: With a warm engine and stable air fuel ratio feedback, the fuel trim is considerably in error to the lean side (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: Open or short in air fuel ratio sensor (bank 2 sensor 1) circuit

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: With a warm engine and stable air fuel ratio feedback, the fuel trim is considerably in error to the rich side (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: Open or short in air fuel ratio sensor (bank 2 sensor 1) circuit
When DTC P0171 or P0174 is stored, the actual air fuel ratio is on the lean side. When DTC P0172 or P0175 is stored, the actual air fuel ratio is on the rich side.
If the vehicle runs out of fuel, the air fuel ratio is lean and DTC P0171 or P0174 may be stored. The MIL is then illuminated.

When the total of the short-term and long-term fuel trim values is within the malfunction threshold (and the engine coolant temperature is higher than 75°C [167°F]), the system is functioning normally.

content5.ptxt: Under closed loop fuel control, fuel injection volumes that deviate from those estimated by the ECM cause changes in the long-term fuel trim compensation value. The long-term fuel trim is adjusted when there are persistent deviations in the short-term fuel trim values. Deviations from the fuel injection volumes estimated by the ECM also affect the average fuel trim learned value, which is a combination of the average short-term fuel trim (fuel feedback compensation value) and the average long-term fuel trim (learned value of the air fuel ratio). If the average fuel trim learned value exceeds the malfunction thresholds, the ECM interprets this as a fault in the fuel system and stores a DTC.
The average fuel trim learned value is +35% or higher, or -35% or less, the ECM interprets this as a fuel system malfunction.

entry.ptxt: Either of the following conditions is met
Either of the following conditions is met
1. Average between short-term fuel trim and long-term fuel trim
35% or higher (varies with engine coolant temperature)
2. Average between short-term fuel trim and long-term fuel trim
-35% or less (varies with engine coolant temperature)

item.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs (even if no DTCs are stored, perform the clear DTC procedure).
Turn the ignition switch off and wait for at least 30 seconds.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on [A].
Start the engine and warm it up until the engine coolant temperature is 75°C (167°F) or higher with all the accessories switched off [B].
With the engine warmed up, idle the engine for 2 minutes or more [C].
Drive the vehicle at a speed between 60 and 100 km/h (37 and 62 mph) for 5 minutes or more [D].

atten2.ptxt: When performing the confirmation driving pattern, obey all speed limits and traffic laws.

item.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes [E].

atten4.ptxt: If a pending DTC is output, the system is malfunctioning.

content5.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0102 for the mass air flow meter sub-assembly circuit.
Refer to DTC P2237 for the air fuel ratio sensor circuit.

atten3.ptxt: Inspect the fuses for circuits related to this system before performing the following procedure.

item.ptxt: Bank 1 refers to the bank that includes the No. 1 cylinder*.
*: The No. 1 cylinder is the cylinder which is farthest from the transmission.
Bank 2 refers to the bank that does not include the No. 1 cylinder.
Sensor 1 refers to the sensor closest to the engine assembly.
Sensor 2 refers to the sensor farthest away from the engine assembly.
A low air fuel ratio sensor voltage could be caused by a rich air fuel mixture. Check for conditions that would cause the engine to run rich.
A high air fuel ratio sensor voltage could be caused by a lean air fuel mixture. Check for conditions that would cause the engine to run lean.

Read freeze frame data using the GTS. The ECM records vehicle and driving condition information as freeze frame data the moment a DTC is stored. When troubleshooting, freeze frame data can help determine if the vehicle was moving or stationary, if the engine was warmed up or not, if the air fuel ratio was lean or rich, and other data from the time the malfunction occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ANY OTHER DTCS OUTPUT (IN ADDITION TO DTC P0171, P0172, P0174 OR P0175)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

entry.ptxt: DTC P0171, P0172, P0174 or P0175 is output
DTC P0171, P0172, P0174 or P0175 and other DTCs are output

atten4.ptxt: If any DTCs other than P0171, P0172, P0174 or P0175 are output, troubleshoot those DTCs first.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK PCV HOSE CONNECTIONS

test1.ptxt: Check the PCV hose connections.
Click here

specitem.ptxt: PCV valve and hose are connected correctly and are not damaged.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check the intake system for vacuum leaks.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If a malfunction is detected while the brake pedal is being depressed, vacuum leaks in the brake booster assembly are suspected. Inspect the brake booster assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (CONTROL THE INJECTION VOLUME FOR A/F SENSOR)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine.
Turn the GTS on.
Warm up the engine and run the engine at an engine speed of 2500 rpm for approximately 90 seconds.

Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor / Data List / All Data / AFS Voltage B1S1 and O2S B1S2 or AFS Voltage B2S1 and O2S B2S2.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor

app-param-unit.app-param: Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor

test1.ptxt: Perform the Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor operation with the engine idling (press the RIGHT or LEFT button to change the fuel injection volume).
Monitor the voltage outputs of the air fuel ratio sensor and the heated oxygen sensor (AFS Voltage B1S1 and O2S B1S2 or AFS Voltage B2S1 and O2S B2S2) displayed on the GTS.

item.ptxt: The Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor operation lowers the fuel injection volume by 12.5% or increases the injection volume by 12.5%.
The air fuel ratio sensor has an output delay of a few seconds and the heated oxygen sensor has a maximum output delay of approximately 20 seconds.
If the sensor output voltage does not change (almost no reaction) while performing the Active Test, the sensor may be malfunctioning.

entry.ptxt: Status AFS Voltage B1S1 or AFS Voltage B2S1
Status O2S B1S2 or O2S B2S2
Air Fuel Ratio Condition and Air Fuel Ratio Sensor Condition

item.ptxt: Fuel injector assembly leak or blockage

Lean: During Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor Active Test, the air fuel ratio sensor output voltage (AFS Voltage B1S1 or AFS Voltage B2S1) is consistently higher than 3.4 V, and the heated oxygen sensor output voltage (O2S B1S2 or O2S B2S2) is consistently below 0.4 V.
Rich: During Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor Active Test, AFS Voltage B1S1 or AFS Voltage B2S1 is consistently below 3.1 V, and O2S B1S2 or O2S B2S2 is consistently higher than 0.55 V.
Lean/Rich: During Control the Injection Volume for A/F Sensor Active Test, the output voltage of the air fuel ratio sensor and the heated oxygen sensor alternate correctly.

atten4.ptxt: Refer to "Data List / Active Test" [AFS Voltage B1S1, AFS Voltage B2S1, O2S B1S2 and O2S B2S2].

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (COOLANT TEMP)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Coolant Temp.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the Data List twice, when the engine is both cold and warmed up.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAF)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Engine Speed, MAF and Coolant Temp.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Allow the engine to idle until Coolant Temp reaches 75°C (167°F) or higher.
Read MAF with the engine speed at 2000 rpm.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FUEL PRESSURE

test1.ptxt: Check the fuel pressure.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR EXHAUST GAS LEAK

test1.ptxt: Check for exhaust gas leaks.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR SPARK (SPARK TEST)

test1.ptxt: Perform a spark test.
Click here

item.ptxt: If the result of the spark test is normal, proceed to the next step.

If the spark plugs or ignition system malfunctions, engine misfire may occur. The misfire count can be read using the GTS. Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Cylinder #1 Misfire Count (to Cylinder #6 Misfire Count).

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT FUEL INJECTOR ASSEMBLY (INJECTION AND VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Check the injection and volume.

item.ptxt: Refer to the fuel injector assembly inspection procedure.

If the fuel injector assemblies malfunction, engine misfire may occur. The misfire count can be read using the GTS. Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Cylinder #1 Misfire Count (to Cylinder #6 Misfire Count).

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT AIR FUEL RATIO SENSOR (HEATER RESISTANCE)

test1.ptxt: Inspect the air fuel ratio sensor.
Click here

entry.ptxt: Front view of wire harness connector

Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Measure the voltage according to the value(s) in the table below.
